```{r, setup, results="hide", message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
```

# toy counts table
```{r}
counts_table = data.frame(gene = c('g1', 'g2', 'g3','g4'),
                          cell1 = c(3,2,1,0),
                          cell2 = c(0,1,2,3),
                          cell3 = c(1,3,0,2)
                          )
counts_table
```

# create module of gene names
```{r}
module = c('g1','g2')
module
```

# module score: mean of cell-wise percent rank for genes in module
- cell with highest module expression -> 1
- cell with lowest module expression -> 0
```{r}
## apply percent rank function to each column (ie cell)
percentiles_table = cbind(counts_table[1], apply(counts_table[2:ncol(counts_table)], 2, percent_rank))

## calculate mean percent rank of module genes
percentiles_table %>% 
  filter(gene %in% module) %>% 
  select(-gene) %>% 
  summarise_all(mean)
```

# Conclusion
cell1 has the highest module expression at 0.83, which can interpreted as the mean expression of genes in the module is around 83 percentile.
